description: Detects Possible usage of Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) binary as a LOLBIN to execute arbitrary linux and windows commands
author: oscd.community
Zach Stanford @svch0st
Nasreddine Bencherchali
false_positives: Automation and orchestration scripts may use this method execute scripts etc
Legitimate use by Windows to kill processes opened via WSL (example VsCode WSL server)
name: Arbitrary Command Execution Using WSL
query: ((((process.executable.text:*\\wsl.exe) OR (winlog.event_data.OriginalFileName:"wsl.exe")) AND process.command_line.text:(*\ \-e\ * OR *\ \-\-exec* OR *\ \-\-system* OR *\ \-\-shell\-type\ * OR *\ \/mnt\/c* OR *\ \-\-user\ root* OR *\ \-u\ root*)) AND (NOT (process.parent.executable.text:*\\cmd.exe AND process.command_line.text:*\ \-d\ * AND process.command_line.text:*\ \-e\ kill\ *)))
